snippet: The Baltimore band Beach House says that Volkswagen, after the group refused to have their song in an ad, used a sound-alike.
abstract: Baltimore pop duo Beach House charges that Volkswagen copied one of their songs for a commercial soundtrack after the group refused to let the company license the tune; are just one of many acts to complain that an ad agency hired someone to mimic its musical style after failing to obtain a license for an original song.
lead_paragraph: The Baltimore band Beach House says that Volkswagen, after the group refused to have their song in an ad, used a sound-alike.

headline.seo: A British Volkswagen Ad Sounds Like Beach House
headline.main: To Singers, Ad Sounds Too Familiar
headline.print_headline: To Singers, Ad Sounds Too Familiar
